original: @71a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @71a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ae ka b'i ra yo g'i ni s'a dha nam n'a ma /
analyzed: ae ka b'i ra yo g'i ni s'a dha nam n'a ma /
translated: Ekavīrāyoginyasādhananāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpa' bo gcig pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpa' bo gcig pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba /
translated: The Means of Attaining the Yoginī of the Sole Heroine, called “The Means of Attainment”

original: zhing chen gyi rje btsun ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: zhing chen gyi rje btsun ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Venerable Tārā of the Great Field!

original: dang po stong pa'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: dang po stong pa'i byang chub ste //
translated: The first is the enlightenment of emptiness,

original: gnyis pa sa bon yang dag bsdus //
analyzed: gnyis pa sa bon yang dag bsdus //
translated: The second is the gathering of the seed,

original: gsum pa gzugs rten yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa gzugs rten yang dag rdzogs //
translated: The third is the perfect completion of the form support,

original: bzhi pa yi ge rim bzhin dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa yi ge rim bzhin dgod //
translated: And the fourth is the arrangement of the syllables in order.

original: ces gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dang po sems can thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa'i snying rje chen po sngon du dmigs la /
analyzed: dang po sems can thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa'i snying rje chen po sngon du dmigs la /
translated: First, visualize great compassion, the desire to attain buddhahood for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'atma konyaham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'atma konyaham /
translated: Om śūnyatājñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’ham

original: zhes brjod pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa'i stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa'i stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By reciting this, meditate on the nature of emptiness as nonconceptual emptiness.

original: gnyis pa ni stong pa chen po'i dbus su pa las sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni stong pa chen po'i dbus su pa las sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar /
translated: Second, in the center of great emptiness, from paṃ, is an eight-petaled multicolored lotus.

original: aa las zla ba /
analyzed: aa las zla ba /
translated: In its center, from aḥ, is a moon.

original: de'i steng du ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor che ba bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor che ba bsam mo //
translated: Upon that, from raṃ, is a large sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i dbus su h'am dmar mo @71b de gyur ba las padma dmar po yu ba la t'am gis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su h'am dmar mo @71b de gyur ba las padma dmar po yu ba la t'am gis mtshan pa'o //
translated: In its center, from haṃ, is a red padma marked with taṃ on the stem.

original: gsum pa ni de las 'od zer 'phros pas dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad mchod /
analyzed: gsum pa ni de las 'od zer 'phros pas dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad mchod /
translated: Third, light rays radiate from that, offering to all heroes and yoginīs,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdig sgrib sbyangs /🔽tshur 'dus nas thim pas rje btsun ma'i sku ru bdag nyid bskyed par bya //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdig sgrib sbyangs / tshur 'dus nas thim pas rje btsun ma'i sku ru bdag nyid bskyed par bya //
translated: purifying the negativities and obscurations of all sentient beings,🔽and dissolving back.

original: zhal bzhi phyag brgyad ma g-yas kyi zhal sngon po /
analyzed: zhal bzhi phyag brgyad ma g-yas kyi zhal sngon po /
translated: One generates oneself as the body of Venerable Vajrayoginī with four faces and eight arms.🔽The right face is blue,

original: g-yon ljang gu /
analyzed: g-yon ljang gu /
translated: the left face is green,

original: dbus dmar po /
analyzed: dbus dmar po /
translated: the central face is red,

original: steng zhi ba'i zhal ser po /
analyzed: steng zhi ba'i zhal ser po /
translated: and the upper face is yellow.

original: khro zhal gsum po la spyan dmar po zlum pa gsum gsum mche ba gtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: khro zhal gsum po la spyan dmar po zlum pa gsum gsum mche ba gtsigs pa'o //
translated: The three wrathful faces have three round red eyes and bared fangs.

original: phyag brgyad kyi dang po na rdo rje /
analyzed: phyag brgyad kyi dang po na rdo rje /
translated: Of the eight arms, the first right hand holds a vajra,

original: gnyis pa na ral gri /
analyzed: gnyis pa na ral gri /
translated: the second a sword,🔽and the third a khaṭvāṅga.

original: gsum pa na ka p'a la /
analyzed: gsum pa na ka p'a la /
translated: On the third [hand] is a skull-cup.

original: bzhi pan da ma ru'o //
analyzed: bzhi pan da ma ru'o //
translated: On the fourth is a damaru.

original: g-yon pa dang po na autpala /
analyzed: g-yon pa dang po na autpala /
translated: In the first left [hand] is a blue lotus.

original: gnyis pa na rin po che /
analyzed: gnyis pa na rin po che /
translated: In the second is a jewel.

original: gsum pa na kha tv'am ga / bzhi pa na dril bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa na kha tv'am ga / bzhi pa na dril bu'o //
translated: In the third is a khaṭvāṅga, and in the fourth is a bell.

original: sku mdog shin tu dmar ba don yod grub pas dbu brgyan byas pa'o //
analyzed: sku mdog shin tu dmar ba don yod grub pas dbu brgyan byas pa'o //
translated: He is very red in color and is crowned with Amoghasiddhi.

original: dpral ba'i steng na thod pa lnga yod pa /
analyzed: dpral ba'i steng na thod pa lnga yod pa /
translated: He has five skulls on his forehead.

original: mi mgo lnga bcu tham pa'i phreng ba'i do shal can /
analyzed: mi mgo lnga bcu tham pa'i phreng ba'i do shal can /
translated: He has a necklace of fifty human heads.

original: rus pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rus pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with bone ornaments.

original: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
translated: He has a tiger-skin skirt.

original: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis padma dang zla ba nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis padma dang zla ba nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs par bsam mo //
translated: Imagine him standing in half-dance posture on a seat of lotus, moon, and sun.

original: bzhi pa ni spyi bor zla ba'i steng du aom dkar po /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni spyi bor zla ba'i steng du aom dkar po /
translated: For the fourth, on the crown, on a moon is a white oṃ.

original: mgrin par padma dmar po'i steng du a'a:dmar po /
analyzed: mgrin par padma dmar po'i steng du a'a:dmar po /
translated: At the throat, on a red lotus is a red āḥ.

original: snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i steng du h'um sngon po bsgom mo //
analyzed: snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i steng du h'um sngon po bsgom mo //
translated: At the heart, on a five-pronged vajra is a blue hūṃ.

original: bzlas pa ni snying ga'i smad du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du autpala dmar po'i yu ba la t'am dmar po bsam /
analyzed: bzlas pa ni snying ga'i smad du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du autpala dmar po'i yu ba la t'am dmar po bsam /
translated: For the recitation, imagine a red tāṃ on the stem of a red utpala flower on top of a sun maṇḍala below the heart.

original: de la sngags kyi phreng ba 'od zer dmar po dang bcas pa spros pas /
analyzed: de la sngags kyi phreng ba 'od zer dmar po dang bcas pa spros pas /
translated: The rosary of the mantra emanates with red light rays.

original: sems can gyi sdig pa sbyangs la /
analyzed: sems can gyi sdig pa sbyangs la /
translated: It purifies the negativities and obscurations of sentient beings.

original: bde ba mtha' dag thob par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba mtha' dag thob par bya'o //
translated: They attain all happiness.

original: tshur 'dus kha nas mar zhugs phyag mtshan sa bon la thim /
analyzed: tshur 'dus kha nas mar zhugs phyag mtshan sa bon la thim /
translated: It returns and enters through one’s mouth and dissolves into the seed syllable in the heart.

original: nang du rang la rtogs pa skyes par bsam mo //
analyzed: nang du rang la rtogs pa skyes par bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that realization arises in oneself.

original: de bzhin du yang nas yang du bsam zhing /🔽aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re h'um phat /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang nas yang du bsam zhing / aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re h'um phat /
translated: Think like that again and again.

original: ces pa nus tshad bzlas so //
analyzed: ces pa nus tshad bzlas so //
translated: Recite the essence mantra as much as possible: oṃ tāre tuttāre ture hūṃ phaṭ.

original: 'jog tsa na sems can thams cad kyis rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par gyur cig bya'o //
analyzed: 'jog tsa na sems can thams cad kyis rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par gyur cig bya'o //
translated: When one stops, one should think, “May all sentient beings attain perfect buddhahood.”

original: de nas spyod lam thams cad sgrol ma'i nga rgyal gyis goms par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas spyod lam thams cad sgrol ma'i nga rgyal gyis goms par bya'o //
translated: Then one should familiarize oneself with all activities with the pride of being Tārā.

original: dpa' mo gcig pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpa' mo gcig pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The Sādhana of the Yoginī of the Sole Heroine is complete.

original: // / pandi ta pa ra he ta dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong shes rab rgyal @72a * //
analyzed: // / pandi ta pa ra he ta dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong shes rab rgyal @72a * //
translated: The pandita Parahita and the Tibetan translator, the monk Sherab Gyaltsen, translated this.🔽

original: mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: The pandit Parahita and the Tibetan translator, the monk Sherab Gyaltsen, translated this.
